alert.note: Alert for Alexander (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 7:56AM EST until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Alexander, Catawba and Iredell. * WHEN...Until noon EST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 753 AM EST, Lookout Shoals Lake lingered above full pool and is expected to remain near 104 feet through at least midday. Between 103 and 104 feet, expect significant inundation of low-lying areas including residential yards, docks, and boat-launch area. Lake floodwaters may be approaching the crawl space of 4867 Longfield St. At 104 feet, lake floodwaters are approaching some homes in the Carpenters Cove community and electricity shutoff is imminent. Residents along Longfield St and in the Carpenters Cove community should have completed the protection of property adjacent to the lake and be prepared to follow guidance from Catawba County Emergency Management. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
